p: Ash (72%) and fibers (75%) were positively correlated with axis 2 ( Fig. 1). The species with high content of ash were Annona senegalensis, Cola pachycarpa, Ricinodendron heudelotii, Scorodophloeus zenkeri, Dichrostachys cinerea, Zanthoxylum zanthoxyloides, Irvingia gabonensis, Xylopia aethiopica, Tetracarpidium conophorum and Parinari excelsa ( Appendix 2, Fig. 2). The species with highest content of fiber were Scorodophloeus zenkeri, Sterculia africana, Acacia macrostachya, Acacia senegal, Xylopia aethiopica, Dacryodes edulis, Annona senegalensis, Blighia sapida, Adansonia digitata and Monodora myristica ( Appendix 2, Fig. 2).
